title: Subprime auto defaults on path toward 2008 crisis levels, say portfolio managers
text: The surge in easy credit during the pandemic, government stimulus payments, and skyrocketing car prices have all begun to bite borrowers with the lowest credit scores.

title: Dividend Watch: 3 Companies Boosting Payouts
text: Several companies have been delivering positive news to shareholders lately, such as dividend increases.

title: Apple (AAPL) Q2 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Decline Y/Y
text: Apple's (AAPL) second-quarter fiscal 2023 results benefit from strong demand for iPhone 14 amid significant forex headwind and challenging macroenvironment conditions.

title: Apple's results send shares surging to nine-month high
text: Apple's stock surged nearly almost 5% on Friday, hitting a nine-month high and on track for its biggest one-day gain since November after the iPhone maker's quarterly results cheered investors worried about a potential recession.

title: This Fund Manager Searched The Globe For The Best ETFs
text: Kevin T. Carter, founder and chief investment officer of EMQQ Global, isn't afraid to travel the world to see where the fastest growth will be coming from. As such, his goal is to create the best ETFs representing that growth.

title: Apple continues to flex its muscles with strong 2Q iPhone numbers, Wedbush analysts say
text: Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) delivered an impressive iPhone beat during its second quarter of 2023 and gave a relatively upbeat outlook going forward, as the consumer electronics giant rides out this macro storm in “Rock of Gibraltar-like fashion”, analysts at Wedbush Securities wrote in a note published on Friday. “An uptick in China demand speaks to further share gains that Apple is seeing with iPhone 14 Pro along with higher ASPs (average selling prices) globally that we believe is now in the $900+ level giving Apple tailwinds in this market,” the analysts said.

title: Why Apple Stock Rallied Friday Morning
text: Record services and iPhone sales carried the day. Apple raised its dividend for the 11th consecutive year.

title: Dow jumps 400 points as Apple earnings, jobs report ease fears
text: PacWest and other regional banks rebounded after tumbling on Thursday.

title: Apple Earnings: Don't Let The iPhone Record Sales Fool You
text: The lack of innovation has put a dent in the company's growth story.

title: WEARABLE WORLD: Will Apple Usher In An AI Future With AR Glasses?
text: One day in the future the smartphone will be replaced. What could that look like?

title: Apple Earnings: iPhone Sales Hit Record Highs
text: Apple delivered a March-quarter record for iPhone sales and an all-time record for services. The company announced its eleventh consecutive dividend increase.

title: Jobs Report: Strong Hiring, Drop In Unemployment Tests The Fed; S&P 500 Futures Rise
text: Friday's jobs report showed solid hiring, faster wage growth and lower unemployment, all bad for the Federal Reserve. But S&P 500 futures rose.

title: Are thousand-dollar iPhones now a necessity? From reactions to Apple earnings, you sure might think so.
text: Turns out thousand-dollar smartphones are still proving to be essential purchases in a tough economy.

title: Sorry Apple, Microsoft is the cool kid again
text: Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL)'s financial engineering with its eye-watering share buy-back programme, now extended by a further US$90bn, reveals a tech giant that's running out of ideas, meanwhile, across Silicon Valley its oft-derided old foe Microsoft showed its ambitions at the bleeding edge of big tech. According to a report by Bloomberg, the Windows firm is closing in on a significant new partnership with AMD, investing in the chip-maker's Athena project which seeks to deliver a new generation of processors designed to power the much-hyped AI revolution.

title: Apple hails record quarter in India as Tim Cook lays groundwork for market to be 'bigger than China'
text: Apple has positioned India as a key market for iPhone sales as well as manufacturing as it looks to reduce its reliance on China.

title: This Top Fund Manager Buys Growth Stocks Without Paying Too Much
text: Daniel Morris, manager of top mutual fund Manor Growth Fund (MNRGX), admits he has a conservative streak. The post This Top Fund Manager Buys Growth Stocks Without Paying Too Much appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Apple Beats Back Recession Worries. Here's Why Analysts Think It Can Keep Winning.
text: The growth of iPhone sales in China and India is reason to back Apple despite concerns of a downturn in consumer spending, analysts say.

title: Is It Too Late to Buy Apple Stock?
text: Apple shares have skyrocketed since its IPO in 1980. However, the company's history of consistent stock growth suggests it has a lot to offer in the coming years.

title: AMERICAS Apple comforts as payrolls loom
text: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan

title: Apple Crushes; Get Ready For All-Time Highs
text: An immediate jump in last night's after-hours session should tell you everything you need to know about Apple Inc's NASDAQ: AAPL Q2 earnings. Investors will have to wait a while and see how shares trade through Friday's session and into next week, but for now, the numbers could well justify a move to fresh all-time highs.

title: Apple hands Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway a $214 million payout ahead of shareholder weekend
text: Warren Buffett could be the recipient of a few extra high-fives walking into the Berkshire Hathaway annual general shareholder meeting this weekend, thanks to the conglomerate's No. 1 holding, Apple Inc.

title: Carvana, Apple, Coinbase and Lyft shift after earnings, and other stocks on the move
text: After a storm of earnings reports following the close of markets Thursday, these were the some of the most active stocks on Friday:

title: This Company Grew Revenue for Shareholders More Than Apple or Microsoft Over the Last Decade
text: Sleep Number grew revenue and reduced its share count dramatically, creating outstanding revenue-per-share growth. However, the company's earnings per share have fallen, unlike Apple and Microsoft's.
